001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
004
005import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
006import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
007import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
008import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
009
010
011/** 
012* <p>This class represents a special geometric mapping for
013* rectifying (i.e., removing the lens distortion from)
014* an image, given the associated camera parameters.
015* The transformation maps any position {@code x'} in the rectified image
016* to the corresponding position {@code x} in the original (distorted) 
017* image. The mapping is implicitly inverted, i.e., maps target
018* to source image coordinates.</p>
019* 
020* <p>Typically usage (by target-to-source-mapping):</p>
021* <pre>
022* ImageProcessor original = ... ;  // the distorted image
023* ImageProcessor rectified = ... ; // the (new) rectified image
024* mapping.applyTo(original, rectified, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
025* </pre>
026*/
027public class RectificationMapping implements Mapping2D {
028        private final Camera cam;
029        private final RealMatrix Ai;    // inverse of the intrinsic camera matrix (2 x 3)
030
031        public RectificationMapping (Camera cam) {
032//              this.isInverseFlag = true;      // maps target -> source
033                this.cam = cam;
034                this.Ai = cam.getInverseA();
035        }
036
037        @Override
038        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d uv) {
039                // (u,v) is an observed sensor point
040                // apply the inverse camera mapping to get the normalized (x,y) point:
041                double[] xy = Ai.operate(MathUtil.toHomogeneous(uv.toDoubleArray()));
042                // apply the camera's radial lens distortion in the normalized plane:
043                double[] xyd = cam.warp(xy);
044                // apply the (forward) camera mapping to get the undistorted sensor point (u',v'):
045                return PntDouble.from(cam.mapToSensorPlane(xyd));
046        }
047        
048//      @Override
049//      public double[] applyTo(double x, double y) {
050//              return this.applyTo(new double[] {x, y});
051//      }
052}
